intro: Hieracium autranii, commonly known as the Autran's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium autranii is often found in sunny, open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
